chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all Court costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA, DV and Vcitim witness surcharges. To be paid from bail on deposit in case 13CF3435.
Court advised that under Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdmeanor crime of domestic violence.

per order dated July 17, 2017, Appeal Nos. 2016AP1045-CR (2013CF1401), 2016AP1046-CR (2013CF1860), 2016AP1047-CR (2013CF3152), 2016AP1048-CR (2013CF3435), 2016AP1049-CR (2014CF0189), IT IS ORDERED that this court will take no action on Terrance Lavone Egerson's pro se motion seeking consideration of additional issues because he is represented by counsel. Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing Proceeded. Private PSI reviewed. DOC PSI reviewed, corrections placed on the record.. Statements by parties and defendant.
 Additional Statements by defendant's mother.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 270 DAYS time served, this is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. Court ordered defendant to Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA, DV, and Victim/Witness surcharges to be paid from bail on deposit in case 13CF3435. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Defendant advised of of right to seek Post-Conviction Relief.

Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Attorney Chernin informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable and therefore, defendant now requests new counsel.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw is heard and granted by the Court.  Attorney Chernin is to inform the Public Defender's Office that the defendant would need to be evaluated to determine eligibility.  Court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 7-7-2014 at 1:30 pm.  
*** COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED UNTIL THE NEXT PENDING COURT DATE.  mld.
Presentence Investigation Report, received and filed.   mld
from defendant addressed to the court, to withdraw his plea that was entered on 4-28-2014.  Defendant is also requesting new defense counsel, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  AS TO COUNT #1: On the motion of the State, Court ordered DISMISSAL of the Domestic Abuse Repeater Enhancer.  

 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO COUNT #1 (w/o the repeater), pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  PSI ordered w/o recommendation.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-20-2014 at 8:30 am.  

Court Amended Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone Contact, that the defendant is allowed telephone contact with his mother and attorney ONLY.
